secondary_translated_text: Food, food, and...

translated_text: 学会害怕。
secondary_translated_text: Learn to be afraid.

translated_text: ...“等一下 ， 我们去睡觉吧。
secondary_translated_text: ... "Wait a minute, let's go to bed.

translated_text: 我们提供免费服务。
secondary_translated_text: We provide free services.

translated_text: 站起来 ， 站起来！
secondary_translated_text: Stand up, stand up!

translated_text: 所有的动物 ， 大小。
secondary_translated_text: All animals, sizes.

translated_text: 你想买酒吗？
secondary_translated_text: Do you want to buy alcohol?

original_en_text: Ho, traveller! With the lands outside fresh struck by fell events, it’s good to see someone still survivin’.<hpage>This new curse proves a threat even to my strengthened shell. For your own safety, barkeep, I strongly suggest you remain within your walls.<page>Aye, well, you’re welcome to do the same. Stay and wash the troubles away with a few bells of nectar... though, given the scale to them shakes, I’m thinkin’ it might take more’n just a few.
original_zh_text: 噢，旅行者！您没事吧？外头刚遭了灾，能见到还活着的虫子真让我宽心。<hpage>酒保先生，劝你最好待在屋内。这新的诅咒连我的甲壳都扛不住。<page>您说的对，您要乐意也可以留下。喝几盏蜜露压压惊……不过看这地动山摇的架势，怕得喝光我的存货才够压惊的。
translated_text: 我的旅行伙伴！我很高兴看到人们活着 ， 因为外层刚刚被拆除。<hpage>这个新的诅咒威胁到我修改后的外壳。<page>你会停留并出汗几次 ， 但鉴于这些振动的强度 ， 你可能需要更多的振动。
secondary_translated_text: My travel partner! I'm happy to see people alive because the outer layer has just been removed.<hpage>This new curse threatens my modified shell.<page>You will stop and sweat a few times, but given the intensity of these vibrations, you may need more vibrations.

original_en_text: Phew. You’re lookin’ a bit raw there, miss. I’m thinkin’ it’ll take more than my nectar to fix you up.<hpage>A parasite of your land has twisted itself into my shell. Its writhing is causing some discomfort.<hpage>If not for my unique constitution, I suspect it would have already consumed me entirely.<page>Well, don’t be bringing such dangerous things in here! Head to the top of the moors. There’s an old doctor up there hiding in her bell.<page>Her remedies are said to often hurt more’n they help, but given your state, I’d say it’s worth the risk.
original_zh_text: 嚯，您看着不太对劲啊，小姐。光靠我的蜜露，可治不了您这毛病。<hpage>我的甲壳里钻入了寄生物，它的蠕动使我不太舒服。<hpage>若不是体质特殊，我可能早被啃噬干净了。<page>啊，别把这种危险的玩意带到我这来！赶紧去沼泽的顶部，那里有一位老医生！她躲在一口钟里。<page>虽说她开的药往往比疾病本身的危害还大，但您这状况值得赌一把。
translated_text: 我认为它有点原始 ， 我不认为汗水可以治愈它。<hpage>你的土地上的寄生虫被埋在我的壳里。<hpage>如果没有我的身体 ， 我会完全吞噬我的身体。<page>“请不要带我这么危险的东西。再过几个小时 ， 沙漠里就会有个老妇人。<page>我经常说你的治疗更有害 ， 但考虑到你的情况 ， 我认为这是值得冒险的。
secondary_translated_text: I think it's a bit raw, and I don't think sweat can cure it.<hpage>The parasites on your land are buried in my shell.<hpage>Without my body, I would completely devour my body.<page>"Please don't bring something so dangerous. In a few hours, there will be an old woman in the desert.<page>I often say your treatment is more harmful, but considering your situation, I think it's worth the risk.

original_en_text: <hpage>Bartender, I’ve been tasked to acquire a nectar of significant age. Would you retain any such drink?<page>After the finer stuff, eh? Sure, I might have a few vessels left, but I can’t be selling ‘em cheap.<page>The shells in my cellar are the last left in Pharloom. Once they’re gone, no bug’ll ever taste such sweetness again.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我在找储存多年的蜜露。你这儿可有存货？<page>嘴巴越来越刁了，小姐？我这应该还剩几瓶，但价钱可不便宜。<page>我地窖里的存货可是纺络最后的陈酿。喝完之后，再也没有虫子能享受到此等蜜酿咯。
translated_text: <hpage>我的任务是准备蜂蜜。<page>当有更好的东西， 不是吗？当然 ， 你可以离开船 ， 但你不能便宜地出售。<page>我的地下室的贝壳是走廊里剩下的最后一件事。一旦它消失了 ， 昆虫就不再喜欢甜味。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>My task is to prepare honey.<page>When there's something better, isn't there? Of course, you can leave the boat, but you can't sell it cheaply.<page>The shells in my basement were the last thing left in the corridor. Once it's gone, insects no longer like sweetness.

original_en_text: <hpage>Another time, perhaps. Among the few gifts of my birth, I find rare need for sustenance.<page>S’at so? Well the nectar’s always on tap if you find yourself feelin’ different.
original_zh_text: <hpage>改日吧。我这副躯壳生来特殊，少有饥渴之时。<page>这样吗？蜜露随时管够，想来一盏就招呼我一声。
translated_text: <hpage>其次 ， 我们意识到我们天生就有很小的天赋 ， 我们不需要保持盈利。<page>是这样吗？否则 ， 蜂蜜很容易使用。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Secondly, we realized that we were born with a small talent and we didn't need to remain profitable.<page>Is that so? Otherwise, honey is easy to use.

original_en_text: <page>Thinkin’ again on the Vintage Nectar?<page>My price might seem steep, but I assure you, the few finer bugs who passed used to pay a lot more.
original_zh_text: <page>还惦记着陈年蜜露？<page>别看我现在出的价高，之前路过的阔绰顾客给得更多呢！
translated_text: <page>你想让山姆回来吗？<page>我的代价可能看起来很高 ， 但我可以肯定 ， 我过去犯过的一些最糟糕的错误得到了更多的回报。
secondary_translated_text: <page>Do you want Sam back?<page>My price may seem high, but I can be sure that some of the worst mistakes I have made in the past have paid off more.

original_en_text: Any chance you’d reconsider dealing with my blasted craw problem? I’d offer fair reward for your efforts.
original_zh_text: 真不打算帮我收拾房顶上的麻烦？酬劳保证让您满意。
translated_text: 想想我不舒服的问题 ， 我会奖励你的努力。
secondary_translated_text: Think about my discomfort and I will reward you for your efforts.

original_en_text: Traveller, I’m not wanting to impose, but I’ve a wish that one of your able sort could likely grant.<hpage>I’ve my own task to attend, good sir, but I’ll hear you out.<page>It’s those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have them slain? If so, your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task?<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above, and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，本不该劳烦您，但有件事非得您这样的利落角色才能办。<hpage>虽然我还有自己的事要去做，但请说吧，先生。<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的躯壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！
translated_text: 旅行者 ， 我不想强迫任何人 ， 但我希望你能理解这一点。<hpage>我有我的工作 ， 但你会感觉到的。<page>螃蟹掉了下来。我的屋顶将成为你的避难所。他们变得勇敢起来 ， 开始攻击路过的朝圣者。<hpage>你想杀了他们吗？如果是这样的话 ， 稳定的扩展就足够了吗 ？<page>我希望它能这么简单。如果你杀死一个以上 ， 你会得到更多。看看房子有多热！你有直接的吸引力。<page>我们正在寻找一个长期的解决方案。我知道我已经尽了最大的努力 ， 它是如此可怕 ， 你可以永远远离螃蟹！
secondary_translated_text: Traveler, I don't want to force anyone, but I hope you understand this.<hpage>I have my job, but you will feel it.<page>The crab fell. My roof will be your refuge. They grew brave and began attacking passing pilgrims.<hpage>Do you want to kill them? If so, is stable expansion enough?<page>I wish it were that simple. If you kill more than one, you will get more. Look how hot the house is! You have direct attraction.<page>We are looking for a long-term solution. I know I've tried my best, it's so scary, you can stay away from crabs forever!

original_en_text: Tis a blessed bit of luck to find this place, eh, sister?<page>The climb’s proved harder than even my best guessin’, but there’s still some vigour left in these old limbs. Doubly so, now I have a belly full of nectar!
original_zh_text: 能找着这酒馆，真算撞大运了！<page>这段攀登比我预想的还要艰难，但我这副老甲壳里仍然残存着些许活力。如今，狠狠灌上几盏蜜露，更是精神倍增！
translated_text: “你很幸运能找到这个地方 ， 姐姐。<page>这很艰难 ， 但前参与者仍然充满活力。"
secondary_translated_text: "You are very lucky to find this place, sister.<page>It was tough, but the former participants were still full of energy. "

original_en_text: Care for a drink, traveller? My nectar’s got a kick that’ll warm your shell in these sodden climes.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，来盏蜜露暖暖身子？这地方湿气重，而我的蜜露最能驱寒。
translated_text: 你想喝点什么吗， 我的朋友？蜂蜜可以帮助你尽可能地保持温暖。
secondary_translated_text: Would you like something to drink, my friend? Honey can help you stay as warm as possible.

original_en_text: Hoy... sister! I’m sat here all bent and bedraggled, but you look fresh as the day you was hatched!<page>How do you fare so well in these drenched and dangerous lands? Maybe you got a secret you could share?<hpage>None that would offer easy aid, good bug. Whatever luck or savvy brought you this far, may it continue on your journey.
original_zh_text: 嘿……小姐！我这破甲壳疼得我直不起腰，你的倒鲜亮得像是刚破卵而出！<page>在这种鬼地方你怎么保养的？有啥秘诀能透露不？<hpage>没有什么秘诀，在这种地方只能靠自己，无论靠的是运气还是智慧。
translated_text: 早上好 ， 姐姐！我坐在一个肮脏的地方 ， 但你看起来像你被摧毁的那一天一样新鲜！"<page>你在这个潮湿而危险的地方做什么 ？我知道她有一个秘密。<hpage>没有人能轻易地帮助你 ， 这是一个错误。无论你多么幸运 ， 即使你明白这一点 ， 我希望你能继续你的旅程。
secondary_translated_text: Good morning, sister! I'm sitting in a filthy place, but you look as fresh as the day you were destroyed! "<page>What are you doing in this humid and dangerous place? I know she has a secret.<hpage>No one can easily help you, that's a mistake. No matter how lucky you are, even if you understand this, I hope you can continue your journey.

original_en_text: <hpage>For now, bartender, I cannot spare so many rosaries.<page>Suit yourself. Maybe you’d rather a pour of the cheap stuff? Give your shell a kick before you head out into our blighted lands.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，眼下我拿不出这么多念珠。<page>没关系，那来盏便宜货？出发前给自己壮壮胆。
translated_text: <hpage>“那堵墙 ， 我不能移走那么多的念珠。<page>想要便宜的饮料吗 ？在进入感染区域之前摘下头盔。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"I can't remove so many rosary beads from that wall.<page>Want a cheap drink? Remove your helmet before entering the infected area.

original_en_text: <hpage>My travels took me through a town beside your moors, in a vein of old bells. Its residents are bound upon a vicious thread.<page>Ahh. So Pharloom’s curse has strung’em tight. A frightful thing. Word’d long gone silent from over their way.<hpage>I suggest you pass warning to your patrons, bartender. If they’re travelling the bellside paths, best they give that place wide berth.<page>Aye. I’ll let’em know, traveller, though in these cursed times, does any safe path still exist?
original_zh_text: <hpage>我路过了一个位于古老钟脉里的小镇，就在这片沼泽旁边，那里的居民全被凶恶的丝线缠绕着。<page>啊……纺络的诅咒把那儿的虫子紧紧束缚，可怕得很。那镇上很久就没有音讯传出来过了。<hpage>酒保先生，我建议你提醒客人们，若是要走钟脉边的小道，务必离那地方远点。<page>没问题，旅行者。不过话说回来，如今这世道哪还有安全的路哟。
translated_text: <hpage>我的旅程经过一个靠近沙漠的村庄 ， 那里挂着古老的纸张。<page>法老的诅咒把他们捆绑得很重。可怕的东西。这个消息是沉默的。<hpage>” 把这个告诉酒保。如果你走在钟楼旁边的街道上， 最好远离这个地区。<page>是的 ， 我会让你知道。在这个该死的时刻 ， 旅行者有安全的路线吗 ？
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>My journey passed through a village near the desert where ancient papers hung.<page>The pharaoh's curse bound them very heavily. Something terrible. The news was silent.<hpage>Tell this to the bartender. If you are walking on the street next to the Bell Tower, it is best to stay away from the area.<page>Yes, I'll let you know. Do travelers have a safe route at this damn moment?

original_en_text: Best be visiting that doctor right quick, miss! She’s up there, at the top of the moors, over toward the bellvein.<page>Her methods might be suspect, but you’re lookin’ sorely in need of service.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您最好赶紧去看医生！就在沼泽顶部的钟脉附近。<page>虽然她的治疗方法很是邪乎，但您这身子骨可拖不起。
translated_text: 你应该先去看医生！他站在沙漠的高处 ， 正在寻找手表。<page>在路上可能会有问题 ， 但需要大量的维护。
secondary_translated_text: You should see a doctor first! He stood high in the desert, looking for his watch.<page>There can be problems on the road, but it requires a lot of maintenance.

original_en_text: Might have taken me a beat to build the courage, but I can feel it, closer now... the Citadel calling me up.
original_zh_text: 我可能得多喝点才能鼓足勇气，继续上路了。但我能感觉到，圣堡离我更近了……它在顶上呼唤我呢。
translated_text: 勇气可能是一个沉重的打击 ， 但现在最近的城堡在召唤我。
secondary_translated_text: Courage may have been a heavy blow, but now the nearest castle is calling me.

original_en_text: <hpage>Here is the Ragpelt, sir. I hope the amount is sufficient for your work.<page>Aye. This should be enough. Once I find a quiet moment, I’ll get straight to building that mighty scarecraw.<page>With a little luck, my roof should be clear of those pests when next you pass by. Thank you kindly, traveller!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，这些是你要的破毛皮。希望足够帮你制作稻草人。<page>够了够了！等我腾出手就去扎稻草人。<page>运气好的话，待你下次路过时，房顶应该已经清静了。衷心感谢你，旅者！
translated_text: <hpage>这就是 Ragfeld！我希望我有足够的钱工作。<page>如果你发现一分钟的沉默 ， 立即做出这种强大的沉默。<page>如果你幸运的话 ， 下次你经过我的屋顶时 ， 你不会看到寄生虫。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>This is Ragfeld! I wish I had enough money to work.<page>If you find a minute of silence, immediately make that powerful silence.<page>If you're lucky, the next time you pass my roof, you won't see any parasites.

original_en_text: If you’re collecting Ragpelt from the crawbugs, those young’ns above here’ll be slim pickings. It’s the mature craws you want, over by the watermound. They’ll drop the stuff a-plenty.<page>Course, you’ll need to do some pointed persuading if you’re planning to separate rag from bug...
original_zh_text: 要收集腐囊虫的破毛皮，房顶那些小崽子可不够用。去水丘旁边找成年腐囊虫，它们身上有更多的货。<page>当然，你得用点“尖锐”的手段，才能让它们乖乖交出毛皮……
translated_text: 如果您正在收集蟹沙贝壳 ， 上述身体是另一种选择。这就是你想要的成熟的螃蟹。把一座山扔在一座水山旁边。<page>当然 ， 考虑到垃圾和昆虫之间的区别 ， 需要一定程度的信心。
secondary_translated_text: If you are collecting crab shells, the above body is another option. This is the mature crab you want. Throw a mountain next to a water mountain.<page>Of course, considering the difference between garbage and insects, a certain degree of confidence is needed.

original_en_text: You’re back, miss! Heard a little commotion below. I trust everything went... erm, smoothly?<hpage><hpage>Sir, your cellar seems to have an ant problem. I assume, in sending me down, it merely slipped your mind to mention?<page>Ah... Oh yes! Well, with your weapon, and talent, and what... I’m sure they didn’t pose a problem? Ahem.<page>And why! I see you’ve collected your prize, so we’ve both come out well from the trade!<page>Enjoy your nectar, miss. No simple pilgrim will ever taste a drop so fine.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您回来啦！底下动静不小……没出什么岔子吧？<hpage><hpage>先生，你家地窖闹蚂蚁，怎么不提前知会？<page>哎！您这身手……小小蚂蚁肯定不在话下嘛！是吧？<page>啊哈！我看您也得到了战利品，这笔交易对咱们双方都算得上圆满！<page>小姐，好好享受这瓶蜜露吧。这滋味普通的朝圣者可尝不着。
translated_text: 当你回到家时 ， 你听到骚乱的声音 ， 你认为一切都结束了 ， 不是吗 ？你同意吗 ？<hpage><hpage>地下室里有蚂蚁的问题 ， 你忘了告诉我吗 ？<page>是的 ， 对。哦 ， 是的！他们使用武器和人才。真的没有问题吗 ？咳嗽 （ 咳嗽 ）<page>为什么呢？我认为我赢了。<page>我希望你能享受你的饮料。
secondary_translated_text: When you get home, you hear riots, and you think it's over, don't you? Do you agree?<hpage><hpage>Did you forget to tell me about the ant problem in the basement?<page>Yes, right. Oh, yes! They use weapons and talent. Are there really no problems? Cough (Cough)<page>Why? I think I won.<page>I hope you enjoy your drink.

original_en_text: Ahh. Fair enough, traveller. You’ve clearly got your own tasks to be on with. I’ll manage, no doubt.
original_zh_text: 唉，理解理解。你毕竟有要事在身，我再想想办法吧。
translated_text: “是的 ， 旅行者 ， 当然 ， 家里有作业。我会处理的 ， 当然。
secondary_translated_text: "Yes, traveler, of course, homework at home. I'll take care of it, of course.

original_en_text: As payment goes, I’ve got something I think you’d make good use of. A spare crafting kit.<page>I’d been holding onto it for someone else, but they’ve been gone long enough now, I know they won’t be returning.
original_zh_text: 酬劳的话，我这有个东西，您应该能用得上——一个多余的制作匣。<page>本来这是要留给别人的，但那位怕是已经回不来了。
translated_text: 付款正在进行中 ， 但我认为你可能会从中受益。<page>我已经为其他人预订了座位 ， 但我知道他们不会回来 ， 因为他们不会在这里呆很长时间。
secondary_translated_text: Payment is in progress, but I think you might benefit from it.<page>I've booked seats for others, but I know they won't come back because they won't be here long.

original_en_text: <hpage>Thank you sir. This is a worthy trade for my work. My tools shall attain an even sharper edge.
original_zh_text: <hpage>多谢先生。这东西对我很有帮助，我的工具将更加锋锐。
translated_text: <hpage>谢谢你 ， 这让我对自己的工作有了很多了解。这个工具是尖锐的。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Thank you, it gave me a lot of understanding of my work. This tool is sharp.

original_en_text: My sore shell will cease tormenting me once I reach the Citadel. It’s sung that all ails are healed just as soon as we step beyond the Grand Gate...
original_zh_text: 现在疼就疼点吧，等我到达圣堡，这一切都不是问题了。据说所有的痛苦都会在迈入巨扉圣门后烟消云散……
translated_text: 当我到达城堡时 ， 有人告诉我 ， 如果我穿过这扇门 ， 我所有的疾病都会被治愈 ， 但痛苦不再困扰我。
secondary_translated_text: When I arrived at the castle, I was told that if I walked through this door, all my illnesses would be cured, but the pain no longer bothered me.

original_en_text: Aye. A fair trade. The aged stuff’s down at the bottom of the cellar.<page>I’ll trust you to collect only the vessel you’re owed. I’d be grabbing it myself, but it’s become a hard climb for my stiffened shell.
original_zh_text: 好嘞，成交。陈酿在地窖最底层。<page>我这副甲壳现在僵硬了不少，不方便上上下下的。劳烦您自个儿去取。我相信您是不会多拿的，对吧？
translated_text: 这是一笔诚实的交易 ， 老人已经在地上了。<page>我自己拿了它 ， 但它变得更难 ， 因为我的外壳很硬。
secondary_translated_text: It was an honest deal, the old man was already on the ground.<page>I took it myself, but it became more difficult because my shell was so hard.

original_en_text: S’only those few stronger pilgrims that survive to reach my home now... Pharloom’s curse claims the rest. Poor sods, left to wander.<page>I do sometimes get to wondering... Is it the dregs of their own mind in there keepin’em walking, or something else entirely...?
original_zh_text: 如今能来到我这儿的，大多是足够强大的朝圣者……剩下的都被纺络的诅咒害成游魂了。<page>我有时候会想……是他们自己残存的意识在支撑行走呢，还是别的什么鬼东西在作祟……？
translated_text: 几个强大的朝圣者幸存下来 ， 来到我家。审判的诅咒带走了其余的 ， 穷人被留在了后面。<page>这狗屎是让他们走的想法 ， 还是完全不同的东西 ？
secondary_translated_text: Several powerful pilgrims survived and came to my house. The curse of judgment took away the rest, leaving the poor behind.<page>Is this shit an idea to let them go, or is it something completely different?

original_en_text: Bellhart, over the moors, a great town I’ve heard it once was, heart of the path’n all, right smack in the middle of these midlands.<page>Now it’s all a’crumble... And that brittle vein of bells is crawling with nasties. Ain’t no place left in Pharloom that can fairly claim to offer safety.
original_zh_text: 这片沼泽上方的钟心镇，当年可是个了不得的地方。位于整个中部地区的腹地，被称为朝圣之路的“心脏”。<page>如今全垮了……那儿的钟脉里爬满脏东西。纺络早没安全地界啦。
translated_text: 我听说 ， 沙漠中的 Berhardt 曾经是一个大城市 ， 它的中心就在他们中间。<page>时钟脆弱的静脉 ， 一切都崩溃了 ， 覆盖着昆虫。法老没有一个地方 ， 我可以声称是安全的。
secondary_translated_text: I heard that Berhardt in the desert was once a big city, and its center was right among them.<page>The fragile veins of the clock, everything collapsed, covered with insects. There is no place for Pharaoh that I can claim to be safe.

original_en_text: You visited them pens up above here, miss? Horrid place, once all about growing meat or some such. Meant to keep us moorbugs livin’, and working, its told...<page>That damned place’s long gone to the Haunting. And now the meat’s running feral and free.
original_zh_text: 小姐，去过上头那个养殖场没？可怕的地方。早先是搞正经蟑螂肉养殖的——为了喂饱我们这些沼泽虫，好让我们认真工作……<page>那鬼地方早被丝咒侵占了。现在，养的蟑螂全都跑出来撒野。
translated_text: 楼上有看到封闭吗？我最害怕的就是肉。湿地里的动物学会了生存和工作。<page>这个地狱已经从出没的地方消失了 ， 生活是自由和野蛮的。
secondary_translated_text: Do you see any closures upstairs? What I fear most is meat. Animals in wetlands learn to survive and work.<page>This hell has disappeared from the place where it haunted, and life is free and barbaric.

original_en_text: Welcome back, traveller. How’d you get along with collecting the Ragpelt from those mangy crawbugs? Their squawking and crooing up there is starting to wear mightily on my patrons!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，你回来啦？破毛皮收集得怎么样？屋顶上叽叽喳喳吵个没完，我的老顾客们都要跑光了！
translated_text: 欢迎回来 ， 旅行朋友们！从一只肮脏的螃蟹身上收集鹅卵石是什么意思 ？他们的尖叫声和叹息声开始对我们的客户产生强烈的影响！
secondary_translated_text: Welcome back, travel friends! What does it mean to collect pebbles from a dirty crab? Their screams and sighs began to have a strong impact on our customers!

translated_text: 你想买酒吗？
secondary_translated_text: Do you want to buy alcohol?

original_en_text: Hmm, holding on to them, eh? I won’t ask why, but I’d sure appreciate it if you reconsider.
original_zh_text: 嗯……不打算交给我？虽然不知道原因，但求您发发善心，再考虑考虑。
translated_text: 我不知道为什么 ， 但我希望你重新考虑。
secondary_translated_text: I don't know why, but I want you to reconsider.

original_en_text: Planning to grab that Vintage Nectar? You passed a fair bundle of rosaries for the bottle, so I figured you’ll be eager to see it yours.<page>The old stuff’s down there, at the bottom of the cellar. I’ll keep the trap open for you, just be swift.
original_zh_text: 准备去取陈年蜜露了吗？您可为它付了不少念珠，我想您肯定也急着将它收入囊中。<page>陈酿在地窖的底层，地窖门给您开着，麻烦您手脚麻利点。
translated_text: 你想喝这种蜂蜜吗 ？我在 Rosalie Hill 穿着衣服 ， 我想看看瓶子会不会很好 ， 所以我打算买一个。<page>我爷爷在地下室 ， 我们打开陷阱 ， 马上动身。“
secondary_translated_text: Do you want to drink this honey? I was dressed in Rosalie Hill, and I wanted to see if the bottle would be good, so I was going to buy one.<page>My grandfather is in the basement. We open the trap and leave immediately.“

original_en_text: Harh! Well met, traveller. Lookin’ for a drink, or a rest, or both?<hpage>Fair greetings, good bug. The warmth of your hearth is welcome upon these wet plains.<page>Aye. It’s a damp climb through these parts. Used to be just pilgrims trekkin’ my way, but odd times these are, and you ain’t even the strangest shell wandering about.<page>A rowdy old warrior stopped through not long back, caused quite a scene, and now a young lass’s taken up lodging in my top room.<page>The lass mentioned she’s on the lookout for sharp types like yourself. Maybe pay her a visit, if you haven’t already?
original_zh_text: 哈！贵客临门。想来盏蜜露，还是歇个脚，或者两样都要？<hpage>这地方真是不错。这湿漉漉的平原上，最缺你这里暖烘烘的炉火。<page>是啊，这地界爬上来可不容易。早先只有朝圣者路过，如今世道古怪，连您这副稀罕甲壳都到处晃悠。<page>前阵子有个老战士在我这儿闹腾得欢，这几天顶层客房又住进个小姑娘。<page>那姑娘正想找您这样的利落角色，有空不妨上楼瞧瞧？
translated_text: 哦！哦！早上好 ， 旅行者 ， 饮料 ， 饮料或两者兼而有之。<hpage>你是个好昆虫。壁炉的温暖是欢迎在这个潮湿的平原。<page>在这个地区 ， 这是一个湿滑的攀登。我曾经是我的路上的朝圣者 ， 但奇怪的是 ， 现在它不再是最奇怪的贝壳。<page>不久前 ， 一个吵闹的老兵停下来制造骚乱 ， 现在一个小女孩睡在我的楼上房间里。<page>她说她一直在寻找像她一样敏感的人。如果我还没看过 ， 可以看吗 ？
secondary_translated_text: Oh! Oh! Good morning, traveler, drink, drink or both.<hpage>You are a good insect. The warmth of the fireplace is welcome in this humid plain.<page>In this area, it was a slippery climb. I used to be a pilgrim on my road, but oddly enough, now it is no longer the strangest shell.<page>Not long ago, a noisy veteran stopped to cause a disturbance, and now a little girl sleeps in my upstairs room.<page>She said she was always looking for someone as sensitive as her. If I haven't read it yet, can I read it?

original_en_text: Excellent, excellent! Let’s give those mangy craws the fright of their lives! Hah!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: 好极了！让那群臭腐囊虫见识见识，什么叫吓破胆！哈！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: 干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！干得好！“给一个患有恶性肿瘤的人一个可怕的生活！"哦 ， 哦。<page>我需要我的龙虾 ， 我会找到它 ， 收集它的皮 ， 带来一袋 ， 然后说 ： “我会做剩下的！ ”"
secondary_translated_text: Well done! Well done! Well done! Well done! Well done! Well done! "Give a person with a malignant tumor a terrible life! "Oh, Oh.<page>I need my lobster, I will find it, collect its skin, bring a bag, and say,"I will make the rest!"”"

original_en_text: The sooner you’ve collected that Ragpelt, the better. I can’t have those pests killing more potential guests.<page>Business is slow enough already, and clearing corpses ain’t no fun at all.
original_zh_text: 赶紧把破毛皮弄来吧，越快越好。不能再让它们杀害我的潜在客户们了。<page>本来生意就不算好，收拾虫尸还费劲！
translated_text: 垃圾收集得越快越好。这些寄生虫不会杀死潜在的宿主 ， 但它们不会杀死它们。<page>现在已经太晚了 ， 摆脱你的身体并不有趣。
secondary_translated_text: The faster you collect garbage, the better. These parasites don't kill potential hosts, but they don't kill them.<page>It's too late now and it's not fun to get rid of your body.

original_en_text: Wantin’ for a drink, traveller? Might soon be the end for all’o us, so no need to go easy on the nectar.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，要来喝一盏吗？反正大伙都快完蛋了，今朝有蜜今朝醉噢。
translated_text: 你想喝点什么吗， 我的朋友？我们不需要在蜂蜜中休息太多 ， 因为我们的结局可能很快就会到来。
secondary_translated_text: Would you like something to drink, my friend? We don't need to rest too much in honey, because our end may come soon.

original_en_text: <hpage>Barkeep, I have seen your request on the bell town’s wishwall. What assistance are you seeking?<page>Ah! Perfect! You’re the able sort that’ll make short work of the task.<page>The problem is those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have me slay them? Your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task.<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我看见钟心镇祈愿墙上有你的委托。所为何事？<page>啊！太好了！可算找着行家了！<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的甲壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: <hpage>酒保 ， 我看到了一些东西订购在贝尔镇欲望的墙上。你需要什么样的帮助？<page>是的 ， 对。哦 ， 是的！理想的！你是那种工作速度快的人。<page>问题是我们有一只螃蟹。我的屋顶将成为你的避难所。他们变得勇敢起来 ， 开始攻击路过的朝圣者。<hpage>你会允许我杀了你吗？它坚固的外壳似乎运作良好。<page>我希望它能这么简单。如果你杀死一个以上 ， 你会得到更多。看看房子有多热！你有直接的吸引力。<page>我们正在寻找一个长期的解决方案。我知道我已经尽了最大的努力 ， 它是如此可怕 ， 你可以永远远离螃蟹！<page>我需要我的龙虾 ， 我会找到它 ， 收集它的皮 ， 带来一袋 ， 然后说 ： “我会做剩下的！ ”"
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Bartender, I saw something ordered on the wall of Desire in Bell Town. What kind of help do you need?<page>Yes, right. Oh, yes! Ideal! You are the kind of person who works fast.<page>The problem is we have a crab. My roof will be your refuge. They grew brave and began attacking passing pilgrims.<hpage>Will you allow me to kill you? Its sturdy shell seems to be working well.<page>I wish it were that simple. If you kill more than one, you will get more. Look how hot the house is! You have direct attraction.<page>We are looking for a long-term solution. I know I've tried my best, it's so scary, you can stay away from crabs forever!<page>I need my lobster, I will find it, collect its skin, bring a bag, and say,"I will make the rest!"”"

translated_text: 我无法安装工具。
secondary_translated_text: I cannot install the tool.

original_en_text: Spear-phial containing Plasmium.<br><br>Injecting the liquid allows one to gain health beyond their natural limits.
original_zh_text: 装载生质液的注射瓶。<br><br>注入液体可突破自然极限恢复生命。
translated_text: 塑料瓶； 塑料瓶；<br><br>注射可以带来超越自然的健康。
secondary_translated_text: plastic bottle; plastic bottle;<br><br>Injections can bring health beyond nature.

original_en_text: Brace of surgical pins from the Whiteward. Used to forcefully insert Silk deep inside a bug’s shell. <br><br>Increases the speed of binding.
original_zh_text: 白愈厅的外科针组，用于将灵丝强制注入甲壳深层。<br><br>加快缚丝速度。
translated_text: 使用白色针支架 ， 将丝绸插入昆虫壳的深处。<br><br>更快速的连接速度。
secondary_translated_text: Using a white needle holder, insert the silk deep into the insect shell.<br><br>Faster connection speeds.

original_en_text: Transform Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 在长椅休息时转换工具。
translated_text: 当仪器放在桌子上时 ， 更换它。
secondary_translated_text: When the instrument is placed on the table, replace it.

original_en_text: Hooked tool for the forceful retrieval of loot from bugs and husks.<br><br>Harpoon into foes to steal rosaries and shell shards, while causing additional damage.
original_zh_text: 从虫尸强行夺取战利品的钩具。<br><br>刺入敌人窃取念珠与甲壳碎片并造成额外伤害。
translated_text: 它被用来强制从昆虫和它们的贝壳中提取食物。<br><br>科佩尔可以刺伤敌人 ， 引爆玫瑰花或碎片 ， 造成额外伤害。
secondary_translated_text: It is used to forcibly extract food from insects and their shells.<br><br>Koppel can stab enemies, detonate roses or fragments, causing additional damage.

original_en_text: Vicious bracelet worn by those who believe they have not been duly punished.<br><br>Increases damage taken, but also increases damage dealt by the needle.
original_zh_text: 自认刑罚不足者佩戴的刑器。<br><br>增加承受伤害，同时提升织针伤害。
translated_text: 相信自己不受惩罚的人 ， 就会被邪恶遮盖。"<br><br>这不仅增加了伤害 ， 而且还增加了针头造成的伤害。
secondary_translated_text: Those who believe that they will not be punished will be covered up by evil. "<br><br>This not only increases the injury, but also increases the injury caused by the needle.

translated_text: 机械设备； 机器；
secondary_translated_text: Mechanical equipment; machines;

translated_text: 指甲的镜子
secondary_translated_text: Nail mirror

translated_text: 它们扩大了。
secondary_translated_text: They expand.

translated_text: 玫瑰大炮
secondary_translated_text: Rose Cannon

original_en_text: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes.
translated_text: 猎取食物并发动致命攻击。
secondary_translated_text: Hunt for food and launch deadly attacks.

translated_text: 关于 screw
secondary_translated_text: About screw

original_en_text: Equip Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 在长椅休息时装备工具。
translated_text: 当你坐在长凳上时 ， 准备好你的工具。
secondary_translated_text: When you sit on the bench, have your tools ready.

translated_text: 奇迹
secondary_translated_text: miracle

translated_text: 显示该图标。
secondary_translated_text: Display the icon.

translated_text: 变形。
secondary_translated_text: Transform.

original_en_text: Flexible belt of serrated metal teeth, able to affixed to the hem of a cloak.<br><br>Flaring the cloak will spin the blades, damaging surrounding enemies.
original_zh_text: 可固定于披风边缘的锯齿金属带。<br><br>挥动披风会旋转利刃伤害周围敌人。
translated_text: 在夹克的末端 ， 有一条由牙齿制成的柔性腰带。<br><br>当你打开外套时 ， 你可以旋转你的刀片并对附近的敌人造成伤害。
secondary_translated_text: At the end of the jacket, there is a flexible waistband made of teeth.<br><br>When you open your coat, you can spin your blade and deal damage to nearby enemies.

original_en_text: Short pins designed to be scattered along the ground.<br><br>The sharp points will pierce any enemy who steps upon them.
original_zh_text: 设计用于撒布地面的短钉。<br><br>尖锐钉头会刺伤踩踏的敌人。
translated_text: 短针 ， 旨在在地面上移动。<br><br>一个锋利的长矛尖将刺穿践踏它的敌人。
secondary_translated_text: Short needles are designed to move on the ground.<br><br>A sharp spear tip will pierce the enemy who steps on it.

translated_text: 多步机 （Multi—step Machine）
secondary_translated_text: Multi-step machine

original_en_text: Twin theatrical tools of a vainglorious bug.<br><br>When binding, emits a searing blast that damages surrounding enemies.
original_zh_text: 虚荣虫的双生戏剧道具。<br><br>当缚丝时释放灼热冲击伤害周围敌人
translated_text: 虚荣心是邪恶的双重戏剧性工具。<br><br>攻击对周围的敌人造成火力伤害。
secondary_translated_text: Vanity is the double dramatic tool of evil.<br><br>The attack causes firepower damage to surrounding enemies.

translated_text: 让我们来看看 Peak 。
secondary_translated_text: Let's take a look at Peak.

translated_text: 我会选择克里斯蒂娜。
secondary_translated_text: I would choose Christine.

original_en_text: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes. Build focus with successive strikes.
original_zh_text: 潜行猎杀，致命打击。连续攻击可积蓄专注。
translated_text: 猎杀猎物并发动致命攻击。
secondary_translated_text: Hunts and launches deadly attacks.

translated_text: 贝壳很强壮。
secondary_translated_text: Shells are strong.

translated_text: 弗罗姆的鸡蛋
secondary_translated_text: Frome's Egg

translated_text: 紧张的船。
secondary_translated_text: A nervous ship.

translated_text: 增强他们的影响力。
secondary_translated_text: Enhance their influence.

translated_text: 去摩擦。
secondary_translated_text: To rub.

original_en_text: Spiral weapon fashioned from a hardened conchspire.<br><br>Thrown at an angle, it can ricochet and catch prey off guard.
original_zh_text: 硬化螺角打造的螺旋武器。<br><br>倾斜投掷可回弹突袭目标。
translated_text: 螺旋炮由壳体的硬端制成。<br><br>当他投掷在一个特定的角落 ， 跳跃和捕获的猎物还没有准备好。
secondary_translated_text: The screw gun is made from the hard end of the shell.<br><br>When he throws in a particular corner, jumps and catches prey that is not yet ready.

translated_text: Filamine 张力
secondary_translated_text: Filamine tension

original_en_text: Playthings carved from magnetic material.<br><br>Used in simple games and believed to bring luck to the bearer.
original_zh_text: 磁性材料雕刻的赌具。<br><br>用于简单游戏，据说能为持有者带来好运。
translated_text: 玩具是用磁性材料制成的。<br><br>在一个简单的游戏中 ， 据信它会给主人带来好运。
secondary_translated_text: Toys are made of magnetic materials.<br><br>In a simple game, it is believed to bring good luck to its owner.

translated_text: 超载是严重的。
secondary_translated_text: Overloading is serious.

original_en_text: Weighted pin and haft, formed to pierce tough shells.
original_zh_text: 加重的穿刺长针，用于穿透坚硬甲壳。
translated_text: 使用一根沉重的针和一个袖子来撕下硬壳。
secondary_translated_text: Use a heavy needle and a sleeve to tear off the hard shell.

translated_text: 他们在使用它。
secondary_translated_text: They are using it.

original_en_text: Light throwing tool, designed for rapid attacks.
original_zh_text: 轻型投掷武器，适合快速连击。
translated_text: 设计用于高速攻击的轻型发射器。
secondary_translated_text: Lightweight launcher designed for high-speed attacks.

original_en_text: Empty spear-phial for injecting Plasmium.<br><br>Acquire more Plasmium to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 空的生质液注射瓶。<br><br>需获取更多生质液补充。
translated_text: 一个半空的小瓶被用于血浆注射。<br><br>带来更多的等离子体到恢复工具。

original_en_text: Quick access container formed from an old shell.<br><br>Increases the quantity of crafted tools.
original_zh_text: 旧甲壳改造的速取容器。<br><br>增加可携带制作工具数量。
translated_text: 用旧贝壳制成的快速存取容器。<br><br>增加复杂工具的数量。
secondary_translated_text: Quick access container made of old shells.<br><br>Increase the number of complex tools.

original_en_text: Equip additional Tools, independent of one’s Crest.
original_zh_text: 可独立于当前纹章装备额外工具
translated_text: 作为一个额外的工具 ， Crest 是一个独立的人。
secondary_translated_text: As an extra tool, Crest is an independent person.

translated_text: 磁性胸罩 （ 推荐磁性胸罩 ）
secondary_translated_text: Magnetic bra (recommended magnetic bra)

original_en_text: Trap-setting tool of the Weavers. Lays a Silk rune that ignites when foes come into contact.<br><br>Uses shell canisters and the wielder’s own Silk.
original_zh_text: 织者布置陷阱的工具，铺设接触触发的灵丝符文。<br><br>需消耗甲壳罐与使用者的灵丝。
translated_text: 它包括一个丝绸皇冠 ， 当敌人被触摸时会激活。<br><br>要使用盒子 ， 您需要使用主人的水槽和丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: It includes a silk crown that activates when an enemy is touched.<br><br>To use the box, you need to use the owner's sink and silk.

original_en_text: Amulet of protection formed from Mossberries.<br><br>As the bearer takes damage, the amulet weeps a green elixir that will form into Silk.
original_zh_text: 苔莓制成的护身符。<br><br>持有者受伤时，护符会渗出可转化为灵丝的绿液。
translated_text: 泡沫制成的防护服。<br><br>当主人受伤时 ， 护身符从绿色药水中掉落并变成丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: Protective clothing made of foam.<br><br>When the owner is injured, the amulet falls from the green potion and turns into silk.

original_en_text: Invigorating beverage prepared by the Flea Caravan.<br><br>Temporarily increases the speed of movement and attacks.
original_zh_text: 跳蚤旅团调制的活力饮品。<br><br>暂时提升移动与攻击速度。
translated_text: 一个冷饮用一辆车的跳蚤。<br><br>暂时增加移动和攻击速度。
secondary_translated_text: A cold drink uses a cart of fleas.<br><br>Temporarily increase movement and attack speed.

original_en_text: Lethal trap formed of tightly bound blades.<br><br>Once placed, the trap will pierce enemies that come into contact.
original_zh_text: 由密集刀片构成的致命陷阱。<br><br>触发后会刺伤接触的敌人。
translated_text: 一个由紧密连接的叶子组成的死亡陷阱。<br><br>一旦你设置了一个陷阱 ， 接触它的敌人就会发现。
secondary_translated_text: A death trap made up of tightly connected leaves.<br><br>Once you set a trap, enemies who touch it will notice it.

translated_text: 面具被打破。
secondary_translated_text: The mask was broken.

secondary_translated_text: Plasma Road

translated_text: 一个细胞的三个细胞。
secondary_translated_text: Three cells in one cell.

original_en_text: Cut swiftly and nimbly with short, precise strikes.
original_zh_text: 以精准、短距攻击进行灵巧切割。
translated_text: 切割速度快 ， 灵活 ， 切割时间短 ， 精确。
secondary_translated_text: The cutting speed is fast and flexible, the cutting time is short and accurate.

original_en_text: Repurposed mechanism from the base of a rosary stringing machine.<br><br>Rosaries must be inserted to reload the cannon.

secondary_translated_text: It can be used in the default calculator.<br><br>You must enter your account to restart.

translated_text: 皮带的重量。
secondary_translated_text: The weight of the belt.

original_en_text: Whip the needle in sweeping swings. Leech the life of foes through twisted roots.
original_zh_text: 扫动织针，通过扭曲根须窃取敌人生命。
translated_text: 轻轻地转动针头。
secondary_translated_text: Gently turn the needle.

translated_text: 你在这里 ： 173
secondary_translated_text: You are here: 173

secondary_translated_text: Weapon of warrior Zacharias<br><br>A small device that jumps between an enemy and a solid surface.

original_en_text: Tear foes with savage slashes. Bind to enter a wild fury and steal life from prey.
original_zh_text: 野蛮撕裂敌人。缚丝进入狂暴状态并窃取生命。
translated_text: 他们以疯狂的愤怒和生活为食 ， 用野蛮的刀刺伤敌人。
secondary_translated_text: They feed on crazy anger and life, stabbing enemies with barbaric knives.

translated_text: 达斯 · 维达！
secondary_translated_text: Darth Vader!

original_en_text: Reflective stone with mnemonic properties.<br><br>When taking damage, a memory of the bearer is formed of crystal. The memory will shatter into sharp spines if an enemy comes into contact.
original_zh_text: 具记忆特性的反光石。<br><br>受击时生成持有者的水晶记忆，接触敌人会爆裂成尖刺。
translated_text: 它是一种具有记忆功能的反光石。<br><br>当它受到伤害时 ， 它的主人的记忆会形成晶体 ， 当它触及敌人时 ， 它会被锋利的刺破。
secondary_translated_text: It is a reflective stone with memory function.<br><br>When it is damaged, its owner's memory forms crystals, and when it touches an enemy, it is pierced sharply.

translated_text: Droid 的眼睛
secondary_translated_text: Droid's Eyes

translated_text: 代替啤酒。
secondary_translated_text: Instead of beer.

translated_text: 石头上刻着几颗珍珠<br><br>清除运输机上所有的污垢。
secondary_translated_text: There are several pearls carved on the stone<br><br>Remove all dirt from the conveyor.

translated_text: 奴隶制的最后日子
secondary_translated_text: The Last Days of Slavery

original_en_text: Sophisticated Weaver device. Resonates with music played to amplify and enhance a performance.<br><br>Expands and strengthens the effects of the Needolin.
original_zh_text: 精密的织者装置，通过音乐共振增强演奏效果。<br><br>增强并扩大织忆弦针的效果范围。
translated_text: 复杂的纺织设备与播放的音乐共鸣 ， 放大并提高性能。<br><br>扩大并增加 Nedrin 的效果。
secondary_translated_text: Complex textile equipment resonates with the music being played, amplifying and improving performance.<br><br>Expand and increase the effect of Nedrin.

original_en_text: Fabric pouch filled with volatile material.<br><br>Explodes on impact with enemies or when ignited by its fuse.
original_zh_text: 填充易爆材料的织物囊。<br><br>撞击敌人或引燃导火索时会爆炸。
translated_text: 大量的鸟。<br><br>它可以在与敌人的碰撞中爆炸 ， 也可以在引信的帮助下点燃。
secondary_translated_text: A lot of birds.<br><br>It can explode in a collision with an enemy or ignite with the help of a fuse.

translated_text: 一座豪华城堡的废墟 ， 保存着温德沃思的丝绸。当需要加工和自然资源稀缺时 ， 它被使用。<br><br>如果失败 ， 储备将恢复执行权力。
secondary_translated_text: The ruins of a luxurious castle hold Windworth's silk. It is used when processing is needed and natural resources are scarce.<br><br>If it fails, the reserve will restore execution power.

translated_text: 谢尔曼先生。
secondary_translated_text: Mr Sherman.

original_zh_text: 殒命朝圣者遗落的钱包。<br><br>使持有者战败时保留部分念珠。
translated_text: 钱包被扔在朝圣者身上。<br><br>如果你不能 ， 你可以放弃玫瑰。
secondary_translated_text: The wallet was thrown at the pilgrim.<br><br>If you can't, you can give up the roses.

original_en_text: Experimental anklets of Weaver make.<br><br>Draws upon the wearer’s own Silk to increase sprinting speed.
original_zh_text: 织者制作的实验性脚环。<br><br>抽取使用者灵丝提升冲刺速度。
translated_text: 链条的实验<br><br>我们用丝绸来加速冲刺。
secondary_translated_text: Experiments on the chain<br><br>We use silk to speed up the sprint.

translated_text: 针
secondary_translated_text: needle

translated_text: Viviano （ 翻译 ）
secondary_translated_text: Viviano (translator)

translated_text: 龙之和平
secondary_translated_text: Dragon Peace

original_en_text: Attack with heavy, arcing slashes and reap additional Silk from enemies.
original_zh_text: 挥舞重弧斩击，从敌人身上收割额外灵丝。
translated_text: 我们用沉重的弓从敌人手中夺走丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: We snatched the silk from the enemy with heavy bows.

translated_text: 指甲的镜子
secondary_translated_text: Nail mirror

translated_text: 快速中断 （Quick Break）
secondary_translated_text: Quick Break (Quick Break)

original_en_text: Holy bell inscribed with a hymn of protection.<br><br>Shields the bearer as they bind their wounds.
original_zh_text: 刻有守护圣诗的圣钟。<br><br>疗伤期间为持有者提供护盾。
translated_text: 种子是用保护雕刻的。<br><br>在伤口愈合过程中保护使用者。
secondary_translated_text: The seeds are carved with protection.<br><br>Protect users during wound healing.

translated_text: 《黑暗的镜子》
secondary_translated_text: "Dark Mirror"

translated_text: 也有动物。
secondary_translated_text: There are also animals.

original_en_text: Empty flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.<br><br>Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 曾装有活力饮品的空瓶。<br><br>需获取更多跳蚤秘酿补充。
translated_text: 瓶子里有一杯冰凉的酒。<br><br>添加跳蚤的眉毛 ， 并恢复工具。
secondary_translated_text: There is a cold glass of wine in the bottle.<br><br>Add flea eyebrows and restore tool.

original_en_text: Emblem of the Order of the Pinstress, the old blademasters of Pharloom.<br><br>Reduces charge time of Needle Strike.
original_zh_text: 纺络地区古针匠组织'针姬教团'的徽记。 <br><br>缩短蓄力斩的蓄力时间。
translated_text: 老农场的叶子 ， 公主奖章的图标。<br><br>缩短针头的装载时间。
secondary_translated_text: The leaves of the old farm, the icon of the princess medal.<br><br>Shorten needle loading time.

original_en_text: Radial sharpbone used by skilled hunters to take down dangerous prey.
original_zh_text: 高阶猎手使用的放射状锐骨武器，用于猎杀危险猎物。
translated_text: 熟练的猎人用锋利的放射状骨头猎杀危险的猎物。
secondary_translated_text: Skilled hunters use sharp radiating bones to kill dangerous prey.

translated_text: 死亡蠕虫的钱包。
secondary_translated_text: The wallet of the death worm.

translated_text: 血浆回收 （ Plasma Recovery ）
secondary_translated_text: Plasma Recovery

translated_text: 灯笼之火 Flair of Lantern
secondary_translated_text: Flair of Lantern

translated_text: Shibo 的速度
secondary_translated_text: Shibo's speed

original_en_text: Equip Tools in the Crest menu<br>while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 在长椅休息时，于纹章界面装备工具。
translated_text: 使用 Crest 菜单线工具<br>我坐在长凳上休息。
secondary_translated_text: Use the Crest Menu Line Tool<br>I sat on the bench and rested.

translated_text: 一个女巫。
secondary_translated_text: A witch.

original_en_text: Arched sharpbone used by hunters to take down flying prey.
original_zh_text: 猎手使用的弧形锐骨武器，用于猎杀飞行目标。
translated_text: 一种锋利的弓形骨头 ， 猎人用来杀死飞行的猎物。
secondary_translated_text: A sharp arched bone used by hunters to kill flying prey.

original_en_text: Reload Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 在长椅休息时装填工具。
translated_text: 他坐在长凳上 ， 拿起了工具。
secondary_translated_text: He sat on the bench and picked up his tools.

translated_text: 格雷格不是这样的。
secondary_translated_text: Greg is not like this.

original_en_text: Intricate tracking device, carved from shell.<br><br>When equipped, the bearer’s location will be marked on their map.
original_zh_text: 甲壳雕刻的精密追踪装置<br><br>装备后可在地图标记持有者位置。
translated_text: 一个精确的跟踪设备被切割到盒子上。<br><br>设备完成后 ， 航空公司的位置将显示在地图上。
secondary_translated_text: A precise tracking device was cut into the box.<br><br>After the equipment is complete, the airline's location will be displayed on the map.

original_en_text: To change Crest, open the Crest screen of the Menu while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 要更换纹章，请在长椅休息时打开纹章界面。
translated_text: 若要修改脊 ， 请从桌面菜单打开脊屏幕。
secondary_translated_text: To modify the spine, open the spine screen from the desktop menu.

translated_text: 针的皮肤。
secondary_translated_text: Needle skin.

original_en_text: Artificial spine that clasps tight around the shell.<br><br>Enhances the wearer’s innate flexibility, allowing rapid retreat.
original_zh_text: 紧扣甲壳的金属脊柱。<br><br>增强持有者灵活性，实现快速撤离。
translated_text: 这些人造柱牢固地固定在头盔上。<br><br>它提供了更大的灵活性 ， 并且可以快速关闭任务。
secondary_translated_text: These artificial pillars are firmly attached to the helmet.<br><br>It provides greater flexibility and can close tasks quickly.

translated_text: 捕捉者先生。
secondary_translated_text: Mr. Catcher.

original_en_text: Convertible orbs containing electricity.<br><br>The vessels can be thrown as a bola for an explosive discharge or staked as a spear to release a column of energy.
original_zh_text: 可转换形态的带电球体。<br><br>作为流星锤投掷引爆，或作为标枪固定释放能量柱。
translated_text: 球的交换是电动的。<br><br>容器可以用作投掷炸弹的炸药 ， 也可以用作释放能量柱的窗口。
secondary_translated_text: The exchange of balls is electric.<br><br>The container can be used as explosive for dropping bombs or as a window for releasing energy columns.

translated_text: 机械设备； 机器；
secondary_translated_text: Mechanical equipment; machines;

translated_text: 技术上很低。
secondary_translated_text: Technically low.

original_en_text: Silk-storing tool of the Citadel, fashioned after an artefact of the Weavers.<br><br>Allows the storing of additional Silk beyond one’s natural abilities.
original_zh_text: 圣堡仿织者遗器制作的储丝装置。<br><br>可突破自然限制储存额外灵丝。
translated_text: 城堡的丝绸仓库是根据纺织工人的技术设计的。<br><br>它可以储存超过自然容量的多余丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: The castle's silk warehouse was designed based on the skills of textile workers.<br><br>It can store excess silk beyond its natural capacity.

original_en_text: Crude trinket worn by collectors and crafters.<br><br>Allows one to collect more shell shards from defeated creatures.
original_zh_text: 采集者与工匠佩戴的粗制饰品。<br><br>击败敌人时可获取更多甲壳碎片。
translated_text: 这对收藏家和编织者来说有点困难。<br><br>你可以从被击败的生物中收集更多的贝壳。
secondary_translated_text: This is a bit difficult for collectors and weavers.<br><br>You can collect more shells from the defeated creatures.

translated_text: 记者的选择
secondary_translated_text: Journalists 'Choice

translated_text: 唯一的预约。
secondary_translated_text: Only appointment.

original_en_text: Gilded piton that allows one to hold in place while on a wall.
original_zh_text: 镀金岩钉，允许在墙面上固定位置。
translated_text: 你可以用金子把石头钉在墙上。
secondary_translated_text: You can nail a stone to the wall with gold.

original_en_text: Tool designed to extract and store fluids.<br><br>To pierce its target, the Needle Phial must first be charged to full tension.
original_zh_text: 设计用于提取储存液体的工具。<br><br>需蓄满张力才能穿透目标。
translated_text: 用于液体提取和储存的工具。<br><br>为了刺穿目标 ， 首先需要在针上施加张力。
secondary_translated_text: Tools for liquid extraction and storage.<br><br>In order to pierce the target, tension first needs to be applied to the needle.

translated_text: 磁性死亡 （ 自杀 ）
secondary_translated_text: Magnetic death (suicide)

translated_text: 磁性时钟 （ Magnetic Clock ）
secondary_translated_text: Magnetic clock

translated_text: 舰队的石头。
secondary_translated_text: Stone of the fleet.

original_en_text: Icon of the mythical mother flea, passed down from caravans of old. A symbol of protection and kinship.<br><br>Decreases the cost of Silk Skills while health is full.
original_zh_text: 旅团传承的传说跳蚤之母圣像，象征庇护与亲缘。<br><br>生命值全满时降低灵丝技能消耗。
translated_text: 跳蚤母亲的神话形象 ， 从古代商队继承下来。它象征着保护和兴奋。<br><br>完整的健康点数降低了丝绸技能的成本。
secondary_translated_text: The mythical image of the flea mother was inherited from ancient caravans. It symbolizes protection and excitement.<br><br>Complete health points reduce the cost of silk skills.

translated_text: 饰 Pimo Anski
secondary_translated_text: by Pimo Anski

original_en_text: Gleaming apparatus of Weaver make. Its core emits a faint glow.<br><br>Increases the speed of Silk regeneration.
original_zh_text: 织者制造的发光装置，核心散发微光。<br><br>提升灵丝恢复速度。
translated_text: Weaver 创造了一种照明设备 ， 其核心发出微弱的光。<br><br>提高丝绸回收率
secondary_translated_text: Weaver created a lighting device whose core gave off faint light.<br><br>Increase silk recycling rate

original_en_text: Powerful amulet of protection formed from many Mossberries.<br><br>As the bearer takes damage, the amulet weeps a green elixir that will form into Silk.
original_zh_text: 多重苔莓强化的护身符。<br><br>持有者受伤时，护符会渗出可转化为灵丝的绿液。
translated_text: 一个强大的防守者用大量的杏仁浆果来做到这一点。<br><br>当主人受伤时 ， 护身符从绿色药水中掉落并变成丝绸。
secondary_translated_text: A strong defender uses lots of almond berries to do just that.<br><br>When the owner is injured, the amulet falls from the green potion and turns into silk.

translated_text: 我无法安装丝绸的技能。
secondary_translated_text: I couldn't install silk skills.

translated_text: 设备与技术开发
secondary_translated_text: Equipment and technology development

translated_text: 他也是一个收藏家。
secondary_translated_text: He is also a collector.

translated_text: 带着胡子的手镯。
secondary_translated_text: Bracelet with a beard.

original_en_text: Equip tools for aid in combat or exploration.
original_zh_text: 装备工具以辅助战斗或探索。
translated_text: 在战斗和冒险中 ， 装备工具。
secondary_translated_text: In combat and adventure, equip yourself with tools.

original_en_text: Heavy band favoured by those with an unsteady step.<br><br>The wearer will recoil less when striking foes and will not be flung as far when taking damage.
original_zh_text: 步履不稳者偏好的重环。<br><br>攻击和受击时不易后退。
translated_text: 重乐队在节奏不稳定的人中很受欢迎。<br><br>当你攻击敌人时 ， 你的反应很小 ， 即使你受到伤害 ， 你也不能投掷。
secondary_translated_text: Heavy bands are popular among people with unstable beats.<br><br>When you attack an enemy, your reaction is very small, and even if you get hurt, you can't throw.

original_en_text: Talisman fashioned from the talon of a large predator.<br><br>Increases the range of needle attacks.
original_zh_text: 大型掠食者利爪制成的护符。<br><br>增加织针攻击范围。
translated_text: 由巨型捕食者的爪子制成的护身符。<br><br>扩大针的范围。
secondary_translated_text: An amulet made from the claws of a giant predator.<br><br>Expand the range of the needle.

original_en_text: Shattered flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.<br><br>Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 曾装有活力饮品的破碎瓶。<br><br>需获取更多跳蚤秘酿补充。
translated_text: 在一个破碎的瓶子里 ， 有水。<br><br>添加跳蚤的眉毛 ， 并恢复工具。
secondary_translated_text: In a broken bottle, there is water.<br><br>Add flea eyebrows and restore tool.

translated_text: 摘下戒指。
secondary_translated_text: Take off the ring.

original_en_text: Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired to its original form.<br><br>Uses shell canisters and the wielder’s own Silk to fire.
original_zh_text: 修复至原始形态的织者古兵器。<br><br>需消耗甲壳罐与使用者的灵丝发射。
translated_text: 旧武器恢复了原来的形状。<br><br>照片是用封面和业主的丝绸盒子拍摄的。
secondary_translated_text: The old weapon returned to its original shape.<br><br>The photo was taken with the cover and the owner's silk box.

translated_text: 圆柱轴 （Cylindrical Axis）
secondary_translated_text: Cylindrical axis

original_en_text: Spin the needle as a screw, shredding foes. Spend Silk to rapidly craft new tools.
original_zh_text: 旋转织针撕裂敌人。消耗灵丝快速制作新工具。
translated_text: 它们像生命一样旋转 ， 粉碎敌人。Flor Silk 正在快速开发新的工具。
secondary_translated_text: They spin like life, crushing enemies. Flor Silk is rapidly developing new tools.

translated_text: 晶体存储器
secondary_translated_text: crystal memory

original_en_text: Flat, layered weapon, crafted to be thrown in a set.
original_zh_text: 分层扁平武器，可成套投掷。
translated_text: 一个精心设计的多层平板步枪 ， 可以组织成一套。
secondary_translated_text: A carefully designed multi-layered flat-plate rifle can be organized into a set.

translated_text: 天空之光 （ 蓝色 ）
secondary_translated_text: Sky Light (Blue)

original_en_text: The Citadel is calling us, sister! We stand so close. We need only the blessing of those bells to see the Grand Gate open.<hpage>I will awaken the bells, pilgrim. With luck, you will not be waiting long.
original_zh_text: 圣堡在召唤，姊妹！我们只有一步之遥了。只需群钟赐福，巨扉圣门定将开启。<hpage>我会敲响那些巨钟。幸运的话，你们无需久候。
translated_text: “姐姐 ， 城堡在呼唤你！我们需要一个仆人的祝福 ， 因为我们离门太近了。<hpage>“亲爱的 ， 我想唤醒钟声。如果你幸运的话 ， 你就不必等太久。
secondary_translated_text: "Sister, the castle is calling you! We need the blessing of a servant because we are too close to the door.<hpage>"Dear, I want to wake up the bell. If you're lucky, you won't have to wait too long.

original_en_text: Only the holy bells of the great path shall open the way!<page>We beg you, traveller, see the bells awoken, that we may cross this final threshold.
original_zh_text: 只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！<page>恳求您，旅行者。令众钟苏醒，我们方可越过这最终的门槛。
translated_text: 只有神圣的街角才能开辟道路。<page>哦 ， 旅行者 ， 你可能会越过最后的门槛。"
secondary_translated_text: Only sacred street corners can open the way.<page>Oh traveler, you may cross the last threshold. "

original_en_text: Ahhh... the gate! The bells have awoken! All along the path. Now we need only music to see them attuned! <hpage>I have recently learnt the art of producing song by strumming Silk, though I confess it is a skill deserving of more practice.<page>Oh! Ohh! Have no doubt, sister! Play sincerely. Any music is sweet enough! Play for us, and surely the bells will resound! Play, and we will sing!
original_zh_text: 啊……巨门！圣钟皆已苏醒！眼下我们只需奏响音乐，使其共鸣！<hpage>我最近习得以灵丝拨弦成曲的技艺，但仍有些生疏。<page>噢！无需顾虑，姊妹！至诚则灵，凡乐皆美！为我们奏响音乐，圣钟必将回应！演奏吧，我们将为你歌唱！
translated_text: 是的 ， 对。门！钟声响了！“在这个过程中 ， 你可以看到音乐中的和谐！"<hpage>最近我学会了触摸丝绸和作曲 ， 但我认为这需要一些练习。<page>哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！哦！是的 ， 是的 ， 但音乐是如此甜蜜。让我们一起玩 ， 敲响钟声！让我们一起唱歌和玩耍！
secondary_translated_text: Yes, right. The door! The bell rings! "In the process, you can see the harmony in the music! "<hpage>I recently learned to touch silk and compose music, but I think it takes some practice.<page>Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Yes, yes, but the music is so sweet. Let's play together and ring the bell! Let's sing and play together!

original_en_text: Ahhh... the Grand Gate! The bells have awoken! <page>We beg you, sister. Play or sing, and we shall follow. Call out to the bells of the path and see the gate open!
original_zh_text: 啊……巨扉圣门！圣钟皆已苏醒！<page>恳求您，姊妹。奏乐咏唱，我们定将跟随你。呼唤圣途钟声，开启此门！
translated_text: 是的 ， 对。门！钟声响了！“<page>“请 ， 姐妹们 ， 玩 ， 喝 ， 继续。我按了门铃 ， 看见门开着。
secondary_translated_text: Yes, right. The door! The bell rings!“<page>"Please, sisters, play, drink, and continue. I rang the doorbell and saw the door open.

original_en_text: We beg you, sister. Delay no further! Play for us. Call out to the bells of the path and see the Grand Gate open!
original_zh_text: 恳求您，姊妹。勿再拖延！为我们奏乐，呼唤圣途钟声，开启巨扉圣门！
translated_text: “姐姐 ， 别迟到了。敲门 ， 看看它是如何打开的。"
secondary_translated_text: "Sister, don't be late. Knock on the door and see how it opens. "

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too seek entry to the Citadel. Have you heard of a means to open this gateway?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 巨门啊……巨门！通往圣堡的巨扉圣门近在眼前！<page>咫尺之遥！门后的尊者啊，求您垂怜！开启通路，容我等卑微朝圣者遁入圣光……<hpage>看来没有守门者回应答你的祈愿。我也想进入圣堡，你可知道开门的办法？<page>唉……兵刃伤不了分毫，也不见锁孔。只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！
translated_text: 门 ， 门 ， 就在我们面前。<page>那东西太近了！开启光明之路吧 ， 可怜的朝圣者。"<hpage>我也想进入城堡 ， 但我没有看到警卫要求朝圣者。<page>是的 ， 对。你不必担心枪 ， 钥匙上没有洞 ， 噪音！圣神的钟声将为你开辟道路 ， 为你开辟道路。
secondary_translated_text: The door, the door, right in front of us.<page>That thing is too close! Open the path of light, poor pilgrim. "<hpage>I also wanted to enter the castle, but I didn't see the guards calling for pilgrims.<page>Yes, right. You don't have to worry about guns, no holes in the keys, noise! The bell of the Holy Spirit will open the way for you, open the way for you.

original_en_text: <hpage>I have passed several such bells, pilgrim. I know how to see them woken. Tell me what you know of their locations, and I shall seek those that still remain silent.<page>Sister? This is a mighty service you willingly perform! What a marvellous gift you would grant to your fellows. <page>Eagerly, I shall tell you of the shrines and their locations, as we have heard them spoken...
original_zh_text: <hpage>朝圣者，我途中遇到过多座此类巨钟，也知晓唤醒方法。请告知余下的位置，我这就去寻找未鸣之钟。<page>姊妹？这是何等伟大的侍奉！您对同伴的馈赠真是慷慨！<page>我会悉数告知神殿方位，将我们听闻的消息原封不动地告诉你……
translated_text: <hpage>“亲爱的 ， 我经历了这些仆人中的一些。我看到你醒了。” 我在寻找一个安静的人。<page>我的姐妹？这是我们作为志愿者所能提供的很棒的服务。这对你的伴侣来说是个很棒的礼物！<page>正如你所听到的 ， 我将详细解释圣殿及其位置。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"Dear, I have experienced some of these servants. I saw you awake." I am looking for someone who is quiet.<page>My sister? This is a great service we can provide as volunteers. This is a great gift for your partner!<page>As you have heard, I will explain the Temple and its location in detail.

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too would benefit from its opening. Have you heard of a means to pass through?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 巨门啊……巨门！圣堡巨扉圣门近在眼前！<page>门后的尊者啊，求您垂怜！开启通路，容我等卑微朝圣者遁入圣光……<hpage>看来没有守门者回应你的祈愿。但开启这道门对我也有好处，你可知道开门的办法？<page>唉……兵刃伤不了分毫，也不见锁孔。只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！
translated_text: 门 ， 门就在我们面前。<page>那东西太近了！开启光明之路吧 ， 可怜的朝圣者。"<hpage>清教徒 ， 我没有看到警卫听你的请求 ， 但我会发现你的开放的好处。<page>是的 ， 对。你不必担心枪 ， 钥匙上没有洞 ， 噪音！“圣灵的仆人正在开辟道路！"
secondary_translated_text: The door, the door is right in front of us.<page>That thing is too close! Open the path of light, poor pilgrim. "<hpage>Puritan, I don't see the guards listening to your requests, but I will find the benefits of your openness.<page>Yes, right. You don't have to worry about guns, no holes in the keys, noise! "The servants of the Holy Spirit are opening the way! "

original_en_text: <hpage>On my journey up, I passed many large bells housed in old shrines. Each I have struck awake, yet still this gate stays closed. What other task must be done to see us pass beyond?<page>The bells are rung? Then this sacred threshold may now be crossed, for the final task is simple! Only music, played fair and true. Music shall attune the bells, and see the gate descend.<page>It must be you to lead us, sister! You, who brought this blessing! Play or sing, and we shall follow.
original_zh_text: <hpage>上行途中，我已敲响诸多钟殿内的巨钟，但此门仍然紧闭。还需要怎样的仪式吗？<page>巨钟皆已鸣响？那这神圣门槛便可跨越！最终仪式简单，唯有真诚演奏的音乐，方能使钟声共鸣，引导大门降下。<page>必须由你来引领我们，姊妹！是你带来了这份恩典。演奏或歌唱吧，我们定将跟随你。
translated_text: <hpage>当我们到达山上时 ， 寺庙里有很多钟声响起。我醒来了 ， 门关上了。我需要解决哪些问题才能克服这些问题 ？<page>这是一个铃铛吗？最后的任务是如此简单 ， 我们已经超过了这个神圣的门槛！音乐是公正和诚实的 ， 音乐会的钟声敲响了门。<page>“姐姐 ， 请你带我去。我希望你能给我们这个祝福！玩 ， 喝 ， 然后走。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>When we reached the mountain, there were many bells ringing in the temple. I woke up and the door closed. What problems do I need to solve to overcome them?<page>Is this a bell? The final task is so simple that we have exceeded this sacred threshold! The music is fair and honest, and the concert bell rings at the door.<page>"Sister, please take me there. I hope you can give us this blessing! Play, drink, and go.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I have communed with the shrine above. Your learnings are unique, techniques born of cogwork hearts. Their mastery will require some commitment on my part.<page>Bug-Red, you are the first organic shell to fuse our memories. S-s-s-such behaviour, my line would have believed improbable-impossible. <page>Still, your broad arsenal did suggest strong affinity with the m-m-m-mechanical craft, enough to allow access to our thought-store.<hpage>Yours is an impressive skill, Master. I am grateful for the insight.
original_zh_text: <hpage>大师，我已拜访上方圣像。你们的知识独特，源自机枢之心。需要我专注投入才能掌握。<page>红姑娘是首个融合我等记忆的血肉之躯。这种行为，按我族逻辑本应不-不-不可行。<page>不过您精通各式武具，确实与机械造诣契-契-合，因此决定开放思维秘藏。<hpage>你们的技艺令我叹服。对这份知识，我感激不尽。
translated_text: <hpage>师父 ， 我接受了上面提到的避难所。它的教学是独一无二的 ， 是从认知思维中衍生出来的能力。学习这些技能需要奉献。<page>巴格达迪 ， 你是我们记忆的第一个有机壳 ， 我们的人民认为这样的行为是不可能的。"<page>然而 ， 他们的大量武器表明 ， 他们的机制与我们的意识形态武器非常接近。<hpage>教授 ， 你的能力令人印象深刻。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Master, I accepted the shelter mentioned above. Its teaching is unique and an ability derived from cognitive thinking. Learning these skills requires dedication.<page>Baghdadi, you are the first person in our memory to have a shell, and our people believe such behavior is impossible. "<page>However, their large number of weapons shows that their mechanisms are very close to our ideological weapons.<hpage>Professor, your abilities are impressive.

translated_text: 我说过了 ， 我承认。
secondary_translated_text: I told you, I admit it.

original_en_text: A fine artefact you carry there, Bug-Red. That broken tool, it is Weaver-make? <hpage>I believe so, Master. A relic of their old workshop, lost in fetid caves beyond this Citadel.<hpage>The parts suggest a weapon of thread, one I would attempt to repair myself, had I endless time.<page>An Architect’s work owes much to the art of the f-f-first children. They set expert standard for the tools and talents of Pharloom eternal.<page>If you desire-demand, I can remake the tool, though my own mind-directives may produce u-u-u-nique result.
original_zh_text: 红姑娘，你身上有件特殊遗物。这残器，是织者造物？<hpage>应该是。织者的旧工坊遗物，在圣堡外的腐臭洞窟里发现的。<hpage>看这构造应该是丝刃兵器。若不是时间有限，我倒想尝试修复。<page>建筑师技艺大多继承自初代织者子嗣。他们为永恒圣堡的器-器-具设下典范。<page>如果您有要求，我可以将它重铸，但成品恐怕会带有我的独-独-独特烙印。
translated_text: 你带来了一个漂亮的手艺 ， 红色的蠕虫。这是一个由材料制成的坏工具吗 ？<hpage>它们是他以前实验室的遗迹 ， 消失在城堡外洞穴的气味中。<hpage>这些碎片就像一支钢笔 ， 所以如果我有时间 ， 我会自己修复它。<page>许多建筑师的作品都与早期儿童的艺术有关 ， 他们为法勒姆时代幸存下来的工具和人才的专业知识设定了标准。<page>您可以重建工具 ， 但我的心理团队将产生独特的结果。
secondary_translated_text: You brought a beautiful craft, red worms. Is this a bad tool made of materials?<hpage>They were relics of his former laboratory, lost in the smell of the cave outside the castle.<hpage>The pieces are like a pen, so if I had time, I would repair it myself.<page>Many of the architects 'work is related to the art of early children, and they set the standard for the expertise of tools and talents who survived the Farham era.<page>You can rebuild the tool, but my psychological team will produce unique results.

original_en_text: An intricate implement of Pharloom’s first children. I can restore-repair the w-w-weapon, though it will bear some trace of my identity-idiom.
original_zh_text: 初代子嗣的精巧造物。我可修-修-复此武具，但会留下我的工造印记。
translated_text: 枪可以修复 ， 但它有身份的痕迹。
secondary_translated_text: The gun can be repaired, but it carries traces of identity.

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our service? We shall create, as is our d-d-directive. To serve, for Pharloom eternal.
original_zh_text: 红姑娘。需要服-服-服务？我将创造，如指-指-指令所示。为永恒圣堡。
translated_text: 这是一个网络 bug 服务。一个网络 bug 服务。你需要吗？他相信与 D—D 命令相同的东西 ： 法老的不朽。
secondary_translated_text: This is a network bug service. A web bug service. Do you need it? He believed in the same thing as the D-D command: the immortality of the pharaoh.

original_en_text: Speak now. Thy confession will be heard.
original_zh_text: 说吧。你的忏悔将被聆听。
translated_text: 您的请求将被听取。
secondary_translated_text: Your request will be heard.

original_en_text: Hrrr. Hrrrrrrr. Them sounds you make. Of holy sort. When me hear such sounds, me remember of home. Me remember of be little.<page>It make it painful hard to work, such remembers. Me must keep working. Please, friend. Do not make them sounds no more.
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔唔。你弄的响动。像圣歌。让咱想起老家。想起小时候。<page>这些回忆让干活揪心。咱得继续干。朋友，求你别弄这些声了。<page>求你了……别再……
translated_text: 是的 ， 是的 ， 是的。你的声音是神圣的。当我听到它时 ， 我想起了我的家。我还记得我年轻的时候。<page>这使得我的工作很痛苦。我知道我必须继续我的工作。快点 ， 朋友。请不要制造麻烦。
secondary_translated_text: Yes, yes, yes. Your voice is sacred. When I hear it, I think of my home. I remember when I was younger.<page>This makes my job painful. I know I have to keep doing my job. Come on, man. Please don't cause trouble.

original_en_text: My s-s-service to you, Bug-Red... As it concludes, I must speak-confess. Long now I have felt my rotors slow their s-s-spin. My limbs lift weak. An ending is felt, coming, sudden-certain...welcome.<hpage>Whatever fading you feel has not shown in your craft, Master. You have provided tools of immaculate make.<hpage>What will follow if you pass? Would another take your place? <page>One cannot. The skill to construct an Architect... That was taken by t-t-time. I am the last-final. The core remains to sustain the song, but no more Architects to tend-toil or build anew. <page>S-s-strange... ‘For Pharloom eternal,’ states the d-d-directive-cage. But how can eternity sustain without an Architect to serve? This seems e-e-error. An end? An error... welcome?
original_zh_text: 为红姑娘效-效-力的时光……临别前必须坦-坦-白。我的齿轮渐-渐缓，臂膀无力。终结将至，突然但确-确-定……真好。<hpage>即便如此，大师的技艺也并未退步。您造的器具堪称完美。<hpage>您逝去后会怎么样，有后继者接任？<page>没有。锻造建筑师的技艺……早已失-失-失传。我是最后一位。核心尚能使圣歌存续，但再无工匠维缮新建。<page>荒-荒-谬……”为永恒圣堡”的指-指-令仍在。但无工匠何谈永恒？错-错-误？终局？错谬……真好？
translated_text: “我在这里等你 ， 红书。最后 ， 我承认这一点有一段时间 ， 我感觉到螺旋桨的旋转速度下降了。我不能抬起我的手臂和腿。当末日临近时 ， 他突然仔细地重新审视。<hpage>师父 ， 不管你变得多么苍白 ， 它都不能反映你的能力。<hpage>如果他们这样做 ， 会发生什么 ？谁来取代她 ？<page>心脏仍然保留着歌曲 ， 但它不再需要建筑师来维护或修复它。<page>有趣的是 ， “为了法老的不朽 ” — 说量子笼。但是 “没有建筑师的服务 ， 我们如何生存 ？ ”” 你看起来错了。档案 ？这是一个错误。欢迎 （ Welcome ）
secondary_translated_text: "I'm waiting for you here, Red Book. Finally, I admitted this. For a while, I felt the rotation speed of the propeller drop. I couldn't lift my arms and legs. As the end approached, he suddenly re-examined it carefully.<hpage>Master, no matter how pale you become, it cannot reflect your abilities.<hpage>If they do, what will happen? Who will replace her?<page>The heart still retains the song, but it no longer requires an architect to maintain or repair it.<page>Interestingly,"for the immortality of the pharaoh"-says quantum cages. But "how can we survive without the services of architects? "You look wrong. Files? This was a mistake. Welcome

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr. Who is there? Me can not... can not clear see....<hpage>At ease, large one. I am no danger to you.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrr! Me see you now! So clean, so lively... Surely you did come from above! Me time has come at last! Me work is done. You come to bring me up! Up, up! Hrrr!<hpage>You mistake me. I am no resident of the Citadel. I am a stranger here, though no foe to you.<page>Hrrr. Hrrrrrrrrr. S-stranger? Me grave mistaken. Forgive me, thems above, for me unworthy hope! Of course, me work is not done! Harder, harder! Me must work harder!
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔。谁？咱看不清……看不清……<hpage>别慌，大块头。我不是你的敌人。<page>唔唔？唔唔！看清你了！这么干净鲜活……肯定是从上层来的！咱终于等到！咱完工了！你是来接咱上去的！上去！唔唔！<hpage>你误会了，我不是圣堡居民，只是旅者。但也不是你的敌人。<page>唔。唔唔唔唔。旅……旅者？咱大错特错。宽恕咱吧，上边的大人们！咱痴心妄想！咱当然还没完工！加把劲！咱得加把劲！
translated_text: 嗯 ， 对吧 ？他是谁？我的意思是， 先生。我看不见他。<hpage>“别担心 ， 我不会有危险的。<page>这是什么 ？你在干什么？哦！哦！我刚刚看到了这个！它是如此干净和活跃， 你必须站起来 “我们的时间终于来了！“我的工作结束了 ， 你在这里帮助我成长。醒来！醒来！噢 ， 噢！<hpage>我误会了 ， 不是城堡里的人。我不是你的敌人 ， 但我是一个陌生人。<page>对不起 ， 但我希望我没有帮助你。当然 ， 我的工作还没有结束！快走 ， 快走！我们需要更多的工作！
secondary_translated_text: Yeah, right? Who is he? I mean, sir. I can't see him.<hpage>"Don't worry, I won't be in danger.<page>What is this? What are you doing? Oh! Oh! I just saw this! It's so clean and active that you have to stand up and "Our time has finally come!" "My job is over, and you are here to help me grow. Wake up! Wake up! Oh, Oh!<hpage>I misunderstood. It wasn't someone from the castle. I am not your enemy, but I am a stranger.<page>I'm sorry, but I hope I didn't help you. Of course, my work is not over yet! Let's go, let's go! We need more work!

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our services, even n-now? Our duty is l-l-long, but we shall create for you, if you require it...
original_zh_text: 红姑娘。此刻仍需要服-服-服务？职责已尽，但如果您需要，仍可制-制造……
translated_text: 这是一个网络 bug 服务。这是一个网络服务 bug 。你现在需要它吗？我们的任务是漫长的 ， 但我们将根据需要创造它。
secondary_translated_text: This is a network bug service. This is a web service bug. Do you need it now? Our task is long, but we will create it as needed.

original_en_text: If Bug-Red could prove their aptitude with our implements, and others like, I would offer my key, to grant access to the chapel-store above.
original_zh_text: 如果红姑娘能证-证-明精通我等器械，我将献上钥匙，用以开启上方圣堂库房。
translated_text: 如果 Bug Krasu 能用我们和其他工具来练习他的技能 ， 我会给他我的钥匙 ， 让他进入上面的教堂商店。
secondary_translated_text: If Bug Krasu could use us and other tools to practice his skills, I would give him my keys and let him enter the church store above.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I seek a melody held by your line, one part of a sequence and key to ascending above the Citadel. Can you teach it to me?<page>Our melody? I r-r-recall! Yes! There was melody, once, but its sound... that I possess no longer...<page>T-t-t-too long I have worked. From my mind-vault, the imprint has f-f-faded. With many things it is like this... remembrance, dimmed...<page>But you m-m-may hear it, still. At the height of our core, there is means-s-s-system, near complete... Constructs old-built to sound our song. They need only be set to functional form.
original_zh_text: <hpage>大师，我想要你这一族保管的旋律，那是登顶圣堡的钥匙。你可愿意传授？<page>我们的旋律？确-确-曾存在！但是声纹……已遗失……<page>长-长-久劳役使我记忆缺损。许多往事……都已模糊……<page>但您仍可-可-可以聆听。核心顶端有一奏鸣构造，几近完成……启动即可重现圣歌。
translated_text: <hpage>师父 ， 我在寻找您的台词所传递的旋律。它是序列的一部分 ， 也是攀登城堡的钥匙。<page>旋律呢 ？请记住我！哦 ， 是的！哦 ， 是的！有一个旋律 ， 但一个声音。我已经没有了。<page>这一段很长 ， 在我内心深处 ， 这个符号已经消失了 ， 有很多东西作为回忆。<page>但是 ， 在我们的核心之上 ， 我们可以感受到一个几乎完整的媒体系统。我们建了一座老房子 ， 唱歌。你只需要把它安装在功能上。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Master, I am looking for the melody conveyed by your lines. It is part of the sequence and the key to climbing the castle.<page>Where's the melody? Please remember me! Oh, yes! Oh, yes! There is one melody, but one voice. I don't have any more.<page>This is a long period. Deep in my heart, this symbol has disappeared and there are many things as memories.<page>But, above our core, we can feel an almost complete media system. We built an old house and sang songs. You just need to install it on the function.

original_en_text: Are you still to c-c-climb our grand core, Bug-Red? Within you may marvel at the work of Architects, my own, and all those passed b-b-before.<hpage>My path takes me in many directions, Master, but in due course, I will ascend the core and claim the melody atop it.
original_zh_text: 您仍要攀-攀-登伟大核心？路上可见历代建筑师的神工创造，包括我的拙作。<hpage>我有许多地方要去，但若是需要，我会登顶获取旋律。
translated_text: 巴格达迪 ， 你还能攀登到大核心吗 ？在里面 ， 你可以欣赏建筑师的工作 ， 我的建筑师 ， 和所有建筑师谁生活在过去。<hpage>师父 ， 我的旅程带我走向许多方向 ， 但在适当的时候 ， 我会到达心灵 ， 并将旋律带到心灵。
secondary_translated_text: Baghdadi, can you still climb to the core? Inside, you can appreciate the work of architects, my architects, and all the architects who lived in the past.<hpage>Master, my journey has taken me in many directions, but at the right time, I will reach the heart and bring the melody to the heart.

original_en_text: <hpage>May I ask what you know of the Citadel above you, sir? You go to much effort to reach it.<page>Hrrrrrrrr! The Citadel! Most miracle of a place, bright and holy! Fresh water for all, much as can drink! Air so clean, can see the great rooves above! <page>When me thinks of Citadel above, me works hardest of all! Hrrrrrrrrr!
original_zh_text: <hpage>请问你对头顶的圣堡了解多少？为了上去这么煞费苦心。<page>唔唔唔唔！圣堡！神迹之地！亮堂圣洁！清水管够！空气清新能望见穹顶！<page>想着圣堡，咱就干得最卖力！唔唔唔唔！
translated_text: <hpage>你知道性爱有多重要吗？他付出了巨大的努力来实现它。<page>哈！城堡啊！“最神圣的地方是最明亮和最神圣的地方！试着喝凉水。天气很冷 ， 可以看到屋顶。<page>当你从上面看到城堡时 ， 你正在努力工作！哦 ， 是的！哦 ， 是的！
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Do you know how important sex is? He put in a huge effort to achieve it.<page>Ha! The castle! "The most sacred place is the brightest and most sacred place! Try drinking cold water. The weather is very cold and you can see the roof.<page>When you see the castle from above, you are working hard! Oh, yes! Oh, yes!

original_en_text: You have confessed a sin most grave and must by works cleanse yourself.<page>Return to your task and work off-cycle, neither eating nor supping until new-cycle begins.<page>By the grace of Pharloom eternal, may you never tire. Toil, and be forgiven.
original_zh_text: 你已供认重罪，须以苦役净化。<page>返回岗位持续劳作，禁食禁饮直至新周期始。<page>承永恒纺络之恩，愿你永不疲惫。劳作，方得救赎。
translated_text: 我们必须承认我们最严重的罪过 ， 并用我们的行为净化自己。<page>不要回到非周期性任务或活动 ， 也不要在新周期开始之前进食或进食。<page>让我们感谢上帝永恒的怜悯 ， 我们永远不会厌倦。
secondary_translated_text: We must confess our gravest sins and purify ourselves with our actions.<page>Don't go back to non-periodic tasks or activities, and don't eat or eat before a new cycle begins.<page>Let us thank God for his eternal mercy and we will never tire of it.

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr! Good, me friend, good! When us works together, is more holy! Is more work done!<page>Together, lets us work raw hard ‘til thems above see how worthy us is!
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔！好，朋友，好！咱一起干，更虔诚！活干得更快！<page>来！咱们一起拼命干，让上边看看咱多卖力！
translated_text: 哦 ， 哦 ， 哦！当我们一起工作时 ， 我们会变得更加圣洁。<page>我们将继续合作 ， 直到最高层的人理解我们的价值观！
secondary_translated_text: Oh, Oh, Oh! When we work together, we become more holy.<page>We will continue to work together until people at the highest level understand our values!

original_en_text: <page>What’s this, Bug-Red? Even down here, I d-d-did detect its working... Have you climbed our c-c-core, and woken the voices of my l-l-line?<hpage>I have maker. Clearly it was a climb never intended for regular bugs, and fair fortune that the skills gifted within your lands allowed my ascent.<hpage>The melody, and the voices... both are fine things heard and witnessed. Even in this fading moment, their artistry shines through.<page>Impressive-industrious... eternal... You have seen a glimpse, Bug-Red, of us-s-s, how once we were. The minds of Architects inspired. What majesty we did create...
original_zh_text: <page>怎么回事，红姑娘？即便身处此地，我也感-感-感知到它的运转……莫非你已攀上我们的核-核-核心，唤醒了我族先辈的歌声？  <hpage>正是如此，大师。这段攀登本非寻常虫类所能企及，所幸这片土地赋予的技艺助我登上了顶端。  <hpage>那旋律与歌声……皆是值得聆听见证的瑰宝。即便在此衰微之际，其中匠心仍熠熠生辉。  <page>勤勉卓绝……永垂不朽……红姑娘，你已见证我族-族-族昔日的荣光。建筑师们迸发的智慧，我们曾创造的伟业何等壮丽……
translated_text: <page>什么是红色字母 ？你进入了我们的 C—C 核心 ， 在 L—L 线上唤醒了我的声音吗 ？<hpage>幸运的是 ， 他的特殊地形技能使他能够攀登。<hpage>旋律， 声音。两人看起来都很漂亮。即使在此时此刻 ， 他的艺术仍然闪耀着。<page>你已经看到了我们的红色昆虫 ， 灵感建立了我们创造的伟大。
secondary_translated_text: <page>What are red letters? Did you enter our C-C core and wake up my voice on the L-L line?<hpage>Fortunately, his special terrain skills allowed him to climb.<hpage>Melody, sound. Both look very beautiful. Even at this moment, his art still shines.<page>You have seen our red insects, the inspiration that builds the greatness of our creations.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this ruined Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place did object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate, it is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage.<page>Why are you here, Bug-Red? The time is late. Do you seek-need service of an Architect? You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weaver, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: <hpage>阁下，你似乎是圣堡最后的工匠，但是要与我为敌么？这里的构造体对我很有敌意。<page>红衣虫？我是制-制-造者。敌人。不是。建筑师。只是建筑师。建造-自动化，并非选择。是本性-指-指-指令牢笼。<page>您为何在此，是寻-寻求建筑师协助？您有织者血脉，是，初代子嗣。稀-稀-稀有种？但又似乎不是。<hpage>你眼光很独到，我确实有织者血脉，但只有一半。<page>那依红姑娘要-要-要求，遵循指令，为纺络初代子嗣，为永恒圣堡，我将效劳。为您制-制-造。
translated_text: <hpage>主啊 ， 我相信你是这座荒芜城堡的唯一创造者。所有的建筑物都强烈反对我的存在。<page>一个红色的盘子？我是一个建筑师 ， 一个建筑师 ， 在自动化中 ， 这是一个自然的序列 — c—c — c 。<page>你在这里干什么？寻求红色建筑师小姐的帮助不是太晚了吗 ？你是一个穿着衬衫的男孩 ， 是的 ， 第一个孩子 ， 罕见的和灭绝的 ， 或者它看起来。<hpage>“主啊 ， 你看这个。我身上有女人的血 ， 还有其他的血 ， 还有奇怪的东西。"<page>那么 ， 根据你的要求 ， 瑞德 ， 根据你的指示 ， 我将使 C—C — C 成为我们永恒的巴拿马王国的长子。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Lord, I believe you are the only creator of this deserted castle. All the buildings are strongly opposed to my existence.<page>A red plate? I'm an architect, an architect, and in automation, it's a natural sequence- c-c - c.<page>What are you doing here? Isn't it too late to ask for help from Miss Red Architect? You are a boy in a shirt, yes, the first child, rare and extinct, or it seems.<hpage>"Lord, look at this. I have women's blood on me, other blood, and strange things. "<page>So, at your request, Rhett, at your instructions, I will make C-C - C the eldest son of our eternal kingdom of Panama.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate is not choice. It is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage. <page>You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weavers, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall serve. I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: <hpage>阁下，你似乎是圣堡最后的工匠，但是要与我为敌么？这里的构造体对我很有敌意。<page>红衣虫？我是制-制-造者。敌人。不是。建筑师。只是建筑师。建造-自动化，并非选择。是本性-指-指-指令牢笼。<page>您有织者血脉，是，初代子嗣。稀-稀-稀有种？但又似乎不是。<hpage>你眼光很独到，我确实有织者血脉，但只有一半。<page>那依红姑娘要-要-要求，遵循指令，为纺络初代子嗣，为永恒圣堡，我将效劳。为您制-制-造。
translated_text: <hpage>“医生 ， 我相信我是这座城堡的唯一创造者。“其他建筑物强烈反对我的存在。"<page>一个红色的盘子？我是一名建筑师 ， 我是一名建筑师 ， 自动化不是一种选择。<page>你是一个穿着衬衫的男孩 ， 是的 ， 第一个孩子 ， 罕见的和灭绝的 ， 或者它看起来。<hpage>“师父 ， 看看这个。我的身体里有女人的血和其他奇怪的东西。"<page>因此 ， 巴格达 ， 应你的要求 ， 我将为法老的长子 ， 我们永恒的王国服务。“C—C — C—C — C—C 你不能 ， C — C 。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"Doctor, I believe I am the sole creator of this castle. "Other buildings strongly opposed my existence. "<page>A red plate? I am an architect, I am an architect, automation is not an option.<page>You are a boy in a shirt, yes, the first child, rare and extinct, or it seems.<hpage>"Master, take a look at this. I have women's blood and other strange things in my system. "<page>So, Baghdad, at your request, I will serve Pharaoh's eldest son, our eternal kingdom. "C-C - C-C - C-C You can't, C-C.

translated_text: 十二代建筑师
secondary_translated_text: Twelve generations of architects

original_en_text: Hrrrrrrr. The harder me work, the sooner it come. Thems above, them watch us, always. Work hard, work hard, and us will go up. Hrrrr.<hpage>Sir, I fear you are long forgotten by your masters. Should you not rest? The burden this toil is placing on your shell is plain to see.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrrrr. You speaks strange. Me can not rest. Us works, and Citadel breathes, and thems above do sing, and all is right.<page>And when us works enough, thems see it... Hrrr... thems see it, and us gets us holy reward...
original_zh_text: 唔唔唔。越使劲干，就越早离开。上边的大人们看着咱呢。使劲干，使劲干，就能上去。唔唔。<hpage>先生，恐怕你早被主人遗忘了。为何不休息？这苦役正在摧残你的甲壳。<page>唔唔？唔唔唔。你说怪话。咱不能歇。咱干活，圣堡呼吸，上边唱歌，这才对劲。<page>等咱干够活，大人们会看见……唔唔……会看见，就给咱圣赐……
translated_text: 工作越努力 ， 工作越快 ， 你就越早到达。他们把注意力集中到了这个问题上。寻找 ， 寻找 ， 站起来。<hpage>忘了你的老师 ， 你是个白痴吗 ？壳的重量是显而易见的。<page>这是什么 ？你在干什么？我们正在做我们的工作 ， 城堡在呼吸 ， 楼上的主题真的在唱歌 ， 一切都很好。<page>如果你足够努力 ， 你会看到的。当你看到它时 ， 你就得到了上帝的奖赏。
secondary_translated_text: The harder you work, the faster you work, the sooner you will arrive. They focused their attention on this issue. Look, look, stand up.<hpage>Forget your teacher, are you an idiot? The weight of the shell is obvious.<page>What is this? What are you doing? We were doing our work, the castle was breathing, the theme upstairs was really singing, and everything was fine.<page>If you work hard enough, you will see it. When you see it, you receive God's reward.

original_en_text: Tools of my craft. They could be used to improve your own. Make harder, sharper.
original_zh_text: 我的工具。可以用于改进您自己的。更硬，更利。
translated_text: 我有我的艺术工具。你可以用它来改善你的个人生活。它让我更强壮 ， 更强壮。
secondary_translated_text: I have my artistic tools. You can use it to improve your personal life. It makes me stronger, stronger.

original_en_text: A flexible shell-prosthetic. It would enhance a weave-type’s flexibility, allowing evasive options.
original_zh_text: 柔性甲壳义肢。能提升织者机动性，便于闪避。
translated_text: 灵活的人造身体 ， 为织物类型增加灵活性 ， 并允许可以避免的选择。
secondary_translated_text: Flexible artificial bodies add flexibility to fabric types and allow avoidable options.

original_en_text: You... ... sin... ... cleanse....<page>Return... ... work... ... begins....<page>... Pharloom... ... never... ... forgiven.
original_zh_text: 你……罪……净化....<page>返回……劳作……周期始....<page>...纺络……永不……救赎。
translated_text: 你是谁？你是谁？不 ， E 。是的 ， 是的。<page>我回来了 ... ...你知道我在工作。你知道我在工作。他开始了。<page>...法老从来没有 ... ...请原谅我。
secondary_translated_text: Who are you? Who are you? No, E. Yes, yes.<page>I'm back... ... You know I'm working. You know I'm working. He started.<page>... Pharaoh never... ... Please forgive me.

original_en_text: You have affinity for such radial blades? I can b-b-build upon the idea-knowledge. Make them retract. Make them force-store.
